intro: Hedyotis sperguloides, commonly known as the small knotweed, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly hairy surface. Hedyotis sperguloides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
